title: Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist Centre)
summary: The Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist Centre), abbreviated CPN (Maoist), CPN-Maoist, CPN Maoist, or CPN(M) (Nepali: नेपाल कम्युनिष्ट पार्टी (माओवादी केन्द्र)), is the largest political party in Nepal. It was founded in 1994 after breaking away from the Communist Party of Nepal (Unity Centre). The party has led three governments, from 2008 to 2009 and from 2016 to 2017 under Pushpa Kamal Dahal and from 2013 to 2015 under Baburam Bhattarai.[4][5][6]
